Baker Hughes Company is an energy technology company with a diversified portfolio of technologies and services that span the energy and industrial value chain . The oil and gas macroeconomic environment continues to be complex. We believe the world will need hydrocarbons for many decades to come . The energy transition will likely take longer than many expected due to its inherent complexity overcoming technology, economics, politics, and regulatory challenges .
 Our strategy is focused on improving our core competitiveness and delivering higher-productivity solutions today . Our unique and diversified portfolio is expected to benefit regardless of how quickly the energy transition develops . We are making strategic investments to drive lower carbon emissions in the energy and industrial sectors, including hydrogen; carbon capture, utilization and storage .
 Oilfield Services & Equipment and Industrial & Energy Technology are among the top providers for the majority of the product lines in the markets they serve . Technology remains a differentiator for us and a key enabler to drive the efficiency and productivity gains our customers require . We are positioned to support our customers' efforts to reduce their carbon footprint with a range of emissions-abatement products .
 OFSE expects to benefit from the emerging demand for more intelligent operations and the adoption of artificial intelligence ("AI") based solutions as part of our customers' digital transformation initiatives . OFSE is also expanding its capabilities and technology portfolio to meet the challenges of the energy transition, including focusing on new energy areas, such as geothermal and geothermal .
 Baker Hughes Company 2024 Form 10-K | 2 provides information on Baker Hughes' four product lines . The OFSE digital group combines OFSE's domain expertise with a deep understanding of the oilfield . Baker Hughes is organized into four product line product lines: drilling, subsea, production, well intervention, and production solutions .
 OFSE provides integrated well services and solutions to plan and execute projects ranging from well construction and production through well abandonment . OFSE customers include large integrated major and super-major oil and natural gas companies . OfSE believes that its principal competitive differentiators in the industries and markets it serves are the technology, quality, efficiency, reliability, and availability of its products and services .
 The IET segment combines a broad array of domain expertise, technologies, software, and services for energy and industrial customers . mpetitors include SLB, Halliburton, NOV, Weatherford, and TechnipFMC . IET solutions unlock the ability to transform, transfer, and transport energy efficiently, while capturing and cutting emissions .
 The product line portfolio includes spare parts, system upgrades, conversion solutions, digital advanced services, and turnkey solutions to refurbish and improve the output from a single machine up to an entire plant . The portfolio includes non-destructive testing technology, software, and services, including industrial radiography, ultrasonic sensors, testing machines and gauges .
 Cordant Solutions technology includes the Bently Nevada® and System 1® product brands, providing rack-based vibrating monitoring equipment and sensors for both power generation and oil and gas operations . The product line's portfolio includes a number of product brands including: Precision Sensors & Instrumentation device technology . Climate Technology Solutions ("CTS") includes CCUS, hydrogen, clean power, geothermal and emissions abatement capabilities to enable energy operators to achieve their emission reduction goals .
 IET differentiates itself from competitors with its diverse portfolio, expertise in technology and project management, local presence, and partnerships . IET competes across a wide range of industries, including oil and gas, power generation, aerospace, and light and heavy industrials . Main competitors include Siemens Energy, Solar (a Caterpillar company), Mitsubishi Heavy Industry, Chart, Sulzer, Flowserve, and Emerson .
 In connection with oil and gas operations, our customers typically indemnify us for certain claims . Certain U.S. states have enacted oil and natural gas specific anti-indemnity statutes . Applicable law or negotiated terms of a customer contract may also limit indemnity obligations in the event of gross negligence or willful misconduct .

 We recognized orders of $28.2 billion, $30.5 billion, and $26.8 billion in 2024, 2023, and 2022 . We also continue to invest and develop technologies that support our customers' efforts to reduce their carbon footprint . For the year ended December 31, 2024, we incurred $643 million of R&D expense .
 In our Completions, Intervention, and Measurements product line, we are investing in intelligent solutions and advanced measurements while creating a leadership position in the well-intervention domain . In our Subsea & Surface Pressure Solutions product lines, we continue to develop subsea production systems that improve performance and reduce emissions through lighter design, automated operations, and electrification .
 Investments in Industrial Technology also include technologies to measure, monitor, and minimize carbon emissions . Baker Hughes relies on patent, trademark, copyright, and trade secret laws to protect our IP rights . Many patents and patent applications comprise the Baker Hughes portfolio and are owned by us . We do not consider any individual patent to be material to our business operations .
 We believe that maintenance, protection and enforcement of our patents, trademarks, and related IP rights is central to the conduct of our business . We may be subject to litigation and infringement claims, which could cause us to incur significant expenses or prevent us from selling our products or services . Our operations can be affected by seasonal events, which can temporarily affect the delivery and performance of our products and services, and our customers' budgetary cycles .
